aboutMeText.greetingSecond: I am Arthur Sharipov, software developer with 1+ year of experience.
aboutMeText.greetingThird: If you need a skilled and reliable developer to deliver high-quality applications, I am exactly who you are looking for!
aboutMeText.greetingFourth: Let’s connect and bring your ideas to life!

experience.description: Initially joined as a Co-op developer (Sep 2025 - Dec 2025) where I developed a responsive company website using Next.js, React, HTML, and CSS, significantly improving the company's online presence and client engagement. I built a full-stack Warehouse Management System (WMS) using Next.js for the frontend and Node.js with Express for the backend to efficiently manage inventory, shipments, and warehouse operations. I designed and integrated a scalable database using PostgreSQL, ensuring accurate tracking of products, orders, and logistics data. Due to the project's success, I was invited to continue part-time (Jan 2026 - Present) to maintain and enhance the WMS platform, adding new features based on evolving warehouse requirements and working closely with the operations team to ensure the system scales efficiently.

At Agile Creative Labs, I worked part-time as a Software Developer Intern with Riipen platform (sponsored by Canadian government), where I got to build real tools that people actually used. I created RESTful APIs in Node.js with a MySQL backend to manage product data and track user adventures. I also integrated an AI model from Hugging Face by writing a REST API layer around it, which made sure responses stayed snappy, usually under 100ms. One of my favorite parts was setting up a Java plugin to trim media files and designing a responsive UI with JavaScript and jQuery—it ended up cutting down the team's manual editing time by nearly half.

At Skill Squirrel, I spent most of my time building and integrating responsive UI components using React and JavaScript. It was a hands-on role where I got to improve the front-end experience and contribute directly to the product. One of the highlights was helping the team save over $10,000 in project costs during the term just by developing components in-house instead of outsourcing.

At Halyk Bank, I worked on projects that directly impacted performance and reliability for tens of thousands of users. I built a borrower-notification reporting service using Kafka to stream events in real time, which cut alert delivery time from nearly 2 minutes to under 5 seconds for about 50,000 borrowers a day. I also created a full-stack Java log viewer with Spring MVC and Thymeleaf, adding backend pagination and search filters that made debugging large log sets 60% faster. One of the biggest wins was refactoring a legacy Spring Boot module by using Java Streams, caching, and async calls, I doubled its speed and reduced CPU usage by around 40% in load tests. I also wrote unit and integration tests with JUnit and Mockito, hitting 85% code coverage and catching two bugs before they made it to QA.
